articles.headline: Megyn Kelly’s Jump to NBC From Fox News Will Test Her, and the Networks
articles.snippet: Ms. Kelly’s departure from Fox News will test her ability to connect with a broader audience, but the most significant implications concern the larger television news industry.
articles.abstract: Ms. Kelly’s departure from Fox News will test her ability to connect with a broader audience, but the most significant implications concern the larger television news industry.
articles.lead_paragraph: For Megyn Kelly, the shift from Fox News to NBC — where she will host a daily daytime show and a Sunday newsmagazine program — will be a test of whether she can connect with a broader audience in a different format and reach another level of television stardom.

articles.headline: A Threat to U.S. Democracy: Political Dysfunction
articles.snippet: Partisan gridlock, and the resulting inability to govern, made the United States’ democratic system vulnerable to a populist insurrection.
articles.abstract: Partisan gridlock, and the resulting inability to govern, made the United States’ democratic system vulnerable to a populist insurrection.

articles.headline: Bitcoin Price Soars, Fueled by Speculation and Global Currency Turmoil
articles.snippet: A tilt toward isolationism in American and European politics has made a currency that can cross borders with little oversight more attractive.
articles.abstract: A tilt toward isolationism in American and European politics has made a currency that can cross borders with little oversight more attractive.
articles.lead_paragraph: SAN FRANCISCO — The virtual currency Bitcoin has been swept up in yet another speculative frenzy, pushing its price toward the peak it last reached in late 2013.

articles.headline: With Choice of Trade Negotiator, Trump Prepares to Confront Mexico and China
articles.snippet: Robert Lighthizer shares a view with the president-elect that the United States has prioritized the ideal of free trade over its own self-interest.
articles.abstract: Robert Lighthizer shares a view with the president-elect that the United States has prioritized the ideal of free trade over its own self-interest.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — President-elect Donald J. Trump on Tuesday named as his chief trade negotiator a Washington lawyer who has long advocated protectionist policies, the latest sign that Mr. Trump intends to fulfill his campaign promise to get tough with China, Mexico and other trading partners.

articles.headline: Anchor Becomes the News as Megyn Kelly Leaves Fox News for NBC
articles.snippet: The No. 2-rated cable television news personality will have a daytime talk show and a Sunday news show that will try to challenge “60 Minutes.”
articles.abstract: The No. 2-rated cable television news personality will have a daytime talk show and a Sunday news show that will try to challenge “60 Minutes.”
articles.lead_paragraph: Megyn Kelly’s new office at NBC News sits a block north of Fox News headquarters in Midtown Manhattan. But it might as well be a world away.
articles.byline: By John Koblin and Michael M. Grynbaum

articles.headline: In Turkey, U.S. Hand Is Seen in Nearly Every Crisis
articles.snippet: Like the failed coup in July and the assassination of Russia’s ambassador in December, the New Year’s Day nightclub massacre is suspected of being a C.I.A. plot.
articles.abstract: Like the failed coup in July and the assassination of Russia’s ambassador in December, the New Year’s Day nightclub massacre is suspected of being a C.I.A. plot.
articles.lead_paragraph: ISTANBUL — Turkish officials accused the United States of abetting a failed coup last summer. When the Russian ambassador to Turkey was assassinated last month, the Turkish press said the United States was behind the attack.

articles.headline: Tech Giants Seem Invincible. That Worries Lawmakers.
articles.snippet: Giant tech companies are usually challenged by start-ups. But with no obvious upstart competitors, it may be governments that pose the biggest threat.
articles.abstract: Giant tech companies are usually challenged by start-ups. But with no obvious upstart competitors, it may be governments that pose the biggest threat.
articles.lead_paragraph: In the technology industry, the sharks have never long been safe from the minnows. Over much of the last 40 years, the biggest players in tech — from IBM to Hewlett-Packard to Cisco to Yahoo — were eventually outmaneuvered by start-ups that came out of nowhere.
